actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'Affliction' (1997). Known for his toothy grin, rugged lankiness, and cool demeanor, he starred in action roles, westerns, and comedies.

filmography.title: Affliction
filmography.role_description: The abusive, alcoholic father whose domineering presence haunts his troubled son.
filmography.plot: A small-town policeman investigates a suspicious hunting death while slowly unraveling under the psychological weight of his abusive father.

filmography.title: The Magnificent Seven
filmography.role_description: An expert knife-thrower and gunman of few words who joins the group to defend a Mexican village.
filmography.plot: Seven gunfighters are hired by Mexican peasants to liberate their village from oppressive bandits.

filmography.title: The Great Escape
filmography.role_description: An Australian heavy-machinery expert known as 'The Manufacturer' who creates tools for the escape.
filmography.plot: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Drama (Film)

filmography.title: Our Man Flint
filmography.role_description: A super-cool, multi-talented secret agent who comes out of retirement to save the world from weather-controlling eco-terrorists.
filmography.plot: When scientists use an eco-weapon to control the weather, a retired secret agent is called back to duty to stop them.

filmography.title: Charade
filmography.role_description: One of the menacing crooks pursuing the fortune allegedly hidden by Reggie's murdered husband.
filmography.plot: Romance and suspense ensue in Paris as a woman is pursued by several men who want a fortune her murdered husband had stolen.

filmography.title: Cross of Iron
filmography.role_description: A battle-hardened, anti-Nazi German sergeant on the Eastern Front who conflicts with his aristocratic captain.
filmography.plot: A German commander and his sergeant clash on the Russian front during World War II.

filmography.title: Duck, You Sucker!
filmography.role_description: An Irish revolutionary and explosives expert who teams up with a Mexican bandit.
filmography.plot: An IRA explosives expert on the run in Mexico meets an amoral bandit, and together they are drawn into the Mexican Revolution.

filmography.title: Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
filmography.role_description: The aging lawman who is hired by cattle barons to hunt down his former friend Billy the Kid.
filmography.plot: An aging lawman is hired by wealthy cattle barons to hunt down his old friend, the outlaw Billy the Kid.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Most Promising Newcomer (Kris Kristofferson)

filmography.title: In Like Flint
filmography.role_description: Coburn reprises his role as the suave super-spy, this time uncovering a plot by a group of women to take over the world.
filmography.plot: Super-spy Derek Flint takes on a cabal of women plotting to take over the world through brainwashing.

filmography.title: The President's Analyst
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist selected to treat the President of the United States, who becomes paranoid as spies from every nation pursue him.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist who is given the job of analyzing the President of the United States becomes a hunted man.

filmography.title: Hard Times
filmography.role_description: A fast-talking, gambling promoter of illegal street fights who manages Charles Bronson's character.
filmography.plot: In the Depression, a drifter and a gambler team up to make money in illegal bare-knuckle fighting.

filmography.title: Ride Lonesome
filmography.role_description: A young outlaw who joins a bounty hunter on a journey, marking Coburn's film debut.
filmography.plot: A bounty hunter trying to bring a murderer to justice is forced to contend with two outlaws who want the bounty for themselves.

filmography.title: Hell Is for Heroes
filmography.role_description: A mechanic and soldier in a squad trying to hold off a German advance with limited resources.
filmography.plot: A squad of American soldiers must hold off a German company for 48 hours until reinforcements arrive.

filmography.title: Major Dundee
filmography.role_description: A one-armed scout who guides Major Dundee's ragtag army into Mexico.
filmography.plot: A Union cavalry officer leads a contentious mix of troops, prisoners, and scouts into Mexico to hunt down Apaches.

filmography.title: The Americanization of Emily
filmography.role_description: A naval officer and friend to the protagonist, whose womanizing ways contrast with the main romance.
filmography.plot: During WWII, an American officer who specializes in procuring luxury goods for his superiors falls in love with a British war widow.

filmography.title: The Last of Sheila
filmography.role_description: A sadistic Hollywood producer who invites a group of friends to his yacht for a mystery game that turns deadly.
filmography.plot: A year after his wife is killed by a hit-and-run driver, a movie producer invites a group of friends on his yacht to play a game to reveal the killer.
filmography.awards: Edgar Allan Poe Award: Win – Best Motion Picture

filmography.title: Monsters, Inc.
filmography.role_description: The voice of the CEO of Monsters, Inc., a crab-like monster who is initially a mentor figure but reveals a darker side.
filmography.plot: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

filmography.title: Bite the Bullet
filmography.role_description: A former Rough Rider and gambler competing in a 700-mile horse endurance race.
filmography.plot: A group of ex-riders, cowboys, and other adventurers compete in a 700-mile endurance horse race across the American West.

filmography.title: Midway
filmography.role_description: A naval officer involved in the strategic planning of the Battle of Midway.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the battle that was a turning point in the Pacific Theater of World War II.

filmography.title: Payback
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking member of the criminal organization 'The Outfit' whom Porter targets.
filmography.plot: After a successful heist, a criminal is betrayed by his wife and partner, left for dead, and then returns to seek revenge and his share of the money.

filmography.title: Maverick
filmography.role_description: The organizer of a high-stakes poker tournament on a riverboat.
filmography.plot: Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief.

filmography.title: The Muppet Movie
filmography.role_description: A cameo as the owner of the rough bar where Kermit meets Fozzie Bear.
filmography.plot: Kermit the Frog and his new found friends trek across America to find success in Hollywood, but a frog-legs merchant is after Kermit.

filmography.title: Dead Heat on a Merry-Go-Round
filmography.role_description: A charming con man who plans to rob a bank at the Los Angeles International Airport.
filmography.plot: A con man plans an intricate bank robbery to take place during a Soviet Premier's visit to Los Angeles.

filmography.title: Waterhole #3
filmography.role_description: A gambler and con artist in search of buried gold in this western comedy.
filmography.plot: A gambler shoots a thief in self-defense and finds a map to a fortune in stolen gold bullion.

filmography.title: Harry in Your Pocket
filmography.role_description: A master pickpocket who teaches his trade to a younger couple.
filmography.plot: A master pickpocket and his partner take on two apprentices, but tensions rise within the group.

filmography.title: Eraser
filmography.role_description: The Chief of the Witness Security Protection Program and mentor to Arnold Schwarzenegger's character.
filmography.plot: A Witness Protection specialist becomes suspicious of his co-workers when dealing with a case involving high-tech weapons.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Sound Effects Editing

filmography.title: Young Guns II
filmography.role_description: A powerful cattle baron who hires Pat Garrett to hunt down Billy the Kid.
filmography.plot: Billy the Kid and his gang are wanted by the law, and when Doc Scurlock and Chavez are captured, Billy has to save them.

filmography.title: Snow Dogs
filmography.role_description: A gruff legendary dog sled racer who is revealed to be the father of the main character.
filmography.plot: A Miami dentist inherits a team of sled dogs and must learn the trade or lose his pack to a crusty mountain man.
